contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=September 2012}} {{Japanese city | Name = Kitamoto | JapaneseName = 北本市 | Region = [[Kantō region|Kantō]] | Prefecture = [[Saitama Prefecture|Saitama]] | MapImage = Kitamoto in Saitama Prefecture Ja.svg | ImageSkyline = Kitamoto montage.JPG | ImageCaption = Top left: Ishidokaba Cherry blossom in Toko Temple, Top right: A fountain in Kitamoto General Park, Center: Konosu Traditional Inn, Nakasen Road in Edo period, Bottom left: Kitamoto Station, Bottom right: Tenjinchigi Shrine | Area_km2 = 19.84 | Population = 69,984 | PopDate = June 1, 2011 | Density_km2 = 3527.42 | LatitudeDegrees= 36 | LatitudeMinutes= 01 | LatitudeSeconds= 26 | LongtitudeDegrees= 139 | LongtitudeMinutes= 32 | LongtitudeSeconds= 01 | Coords = {{coord|36|01|26|N|139|32|01|E|region:JP_type:city}} | Mayor = Kenji Ishizu (since May 2003) | Tree = [[Cherry blossom]] | Flower = [[Chrysanthemum]] | Bird = | SymbolImage= Flag of Kitamoto Saitama.svg | CityHallPostalCode = 364-8633 | CityHallAddress= 1-111 Honmachi, Kitamoto-shi, Saitama-ken | CityHallPhone=048-591-1111 | CityHallLink = {{URL|http://www.city.kitamoto.saitama.jp}} | CityMap= }} {{nihongo|'''Kitamoto'''|北本市|Kitamoto-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] in [[Saitama Prefecture]], Japan. As of June 1, 2011, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 70,237 with 27,714 [[household]]s and a [[population density]] of 3,527.42 persons per km². The total area is 19.84 km². The city was founded on November 3, 1971. == Transportation == ===Rail=== *[[Kitamoto Station]] on the [[Takasaki Line]] ([[East Japan Railway Company]]) ===Road=== *[[Japan National Route 17|National Route 17]] ==Sister cities== Kitamoto has been [[town twinning|twinned]] with [[Aizubange, Fukushima]] in Japan since 1992.{{Citation needed|date=November 2012}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.city.kitamoto.saitama.jp}} {{ja icon}} {{Saitama}} [[Category:Cities in Saitama Prefecture]]
